title: Authors and Citation
text: Schramm M (2023). twriTemplates: Templates TWRI reports. https://github.com/TxWRI/twriTemplates, https://txwri.github.io/twriTemplates/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {twriTemplates: Templates for TWRI reports},   author = {Michael Schramm},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/TxWRI/twriTemplates, https://txwri.github.io/twriTemplates/}, }

title: Templates for TWRI reports
text: package provides: Rmarkdown templates MS Word pdf documents follow recommended brand guidance ggplot themes common design styles projects custom pkgdown template TWRI packages

title: Templates for TWRI reports
text: easiest way install twriTemplates r-universe repository: twriTemplates also lives Github can built source using:
code: options(repos = c(   txwri = 'https://txwri.r-universe.dev',   CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org')) install.packages("twriTemplates") install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("TxWRI/twriTemplates")

title: Templates for TWRI reports
text: Rmarkdown templates assume required fonts installed system. Minion Pro font among others used various templates themes. aren’t licensed distribute fonts. Install fonts AgriLife provides Marketing Communications branding website. order use pdf template, please install tinytex package: Make sure last function returns TRUE.

title: Templates for TWRI reports
text: Create new Rmarkdown document, select “Template”, TWRI PDF template TWRI doc template available list. Screenshot rmarkdown template selector new .Rmd file open example text guidance document.

title: Templates for TWRI reports
text: ggplot themes provided print powerpoint presentation. main difference fonts presentation styled theme scaled larger facilitate reading back row auditorium. also function add TWRI branding plots.
code: library(twriTemplates) #> See https://github.com/TxWRI/twriTemplates for more details, use the Issues tab if you have questions. library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  ## report theme p1 <- dissolved_oxygen %>%   mutate(station_id = as.factor(station_id)) %>%   ggplot(aes(station_id,               min_do,               fill = station_id,               color = station_id)) +   geom_boxplot(alpha = 0.5) +   geom_jitter(alpha = 0.9, width = 0.1, height = 0) +   theme_TWRI_print() +   scale_color_discrete_twri(name = "Station ID") +   scale_fill_discrete_twri(name = "Station ID") +   labs(x = "Station ID",         y = "Dissolved Oxygen, Min [mg/L]",         title = "24-hr Minimum Dissolved Oxygen, Tres Palacios River",        caption = "Source: TCEQ SWQM") p1 ## presentation theme ## suggested export size is 10 inches wide by 7.5 inches tall. p2 <- dissolved_oxygen %>%   mutate(station_id = as.factor(station_id)) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = min_do,               fill = station_id,               color = station_id)) +   geom_histogram(alpha = 0.5) +   facet_wrap(~station_id) +   theme_TWRI_pres() +   scale_color_discrete_twri(name = "Station ID") +   scale_fill_discrete_twri(name = "Station ID") +   labs(x = "Dissolved Oxygen, Min [mg/L]",        y = "n measurements",        title = "24-hr Minimum Dissolved Oxygen, Tres Palacios River",        caption = "Source: TCEQ SWQM") +   theme(legend.position = "none") p2 #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. add_TWRI_logo(p2, scale = 0.2) #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.

title: Templates for TWRI reports
text: add/edit _pkgdown.yaml package root directory: add following DESCRIPTION:
code: template:   package: twriTemplates   bootstrap: 5  navbar:   type: dark   bg: dark   structure:     right: [search, github] Config/Needs/website: TxWRI/twriTemplates

what: Dissolved oxygen measurements from the Tres Palacios river — dissolved_oxygen
title: Dissolved oxygen measurements from the Tres Palacios river — dissolved_oxygen
text: Data Texas Commission Environmental Quality Surface Water Quality Monitoring Information System. Average_DO`` field mean dissolved oxygen concentrations (mg/L) measured field site day. Min_DO` field minimum dissolved oxygen concentration measured site day.

title: Dissolved oxygen measurements from the Tres Palacios river — dissolved_oxygen
Dissolved oxygen measurements from the Tres Palacios river — dissolved_oxygen
text: data frame 236 rows 6 variables: station_id unique water quality monitoring station identifier end_date sampling date yyyy-mm-dd format parameter_code unique parameter code parameter_description parameter description units average_do mean dissolved oxygen measurement, mg/L min_do minimum dissolved oxygen measurement, mg/L

title: Dissolved oxygen measurements from the Tres Palacios river — dissolved_oxygen
text: https://www80.tceq.texas.gov/SwqmisPublic/public/default.htm

title: Add logo to ggplot — add_TWRI_logo

text: plot ggplot object scale scale logo, defaults 0.25 halign aligns logo within ggplot [0-1] valign aligns logo within ggplot [0-1]

title: Add logo to ggplot — add_TWRI_logo
text: ggplot object

what: Water quality data from two sites on the Arroyo Colorado — arroyo_wetland
title: Water quality data from two sites on the Arroyo Colorado — arroyo_wetland
text: Includes water quality monitoring data two sites Arroyo Colorado 1973 2022. Multiple parameters included. Station 13079 upstream station 13074. 2011 treatment wetland started operation wastewater treatment plant two stations. data typical data downloaded TCEQ SWQMIS database.

title: Water quality data from two sites on the Arroyo Colorado — arroyo_wetland
Water quality data from two sites on the Arroyo Colorado — arroyo_wetland
text: data frame 7005 rows 13 variables: basin_id two digit basin identifier segment_id TCEQ segment identifier on_segment data flag indicating location station rfa_tag_id trip identifer, records value collected trip location station_id station identifier end_date monitoring trip date end_time time collection end_depth depth sample collected monitoring_type monitoring type codes used distinguish monitoring purporse. TCEQ DMRG includes record description type codes parameter_code distinct parameter codes described greater_than_less_than censored data flag; "<" indicates minimum detection limit, ">" indicates maximum detection limit value measured value mdl minimum detection limit reported lab

title: Water quality data from two sites on the Arroyo Colorado — arroyo_wetland
text: TCEQ SWQMIS database.

Create a Boxplot Legend — ggplot_box_legend
text: Create legend explains features boxplot. Can added easily existing ggplots using plot_grid plot_arithmetic.

title: Create a Boxplot Legend — ggplot_box_legend
Create a Boxplot Legend — ggplot_box_legend
text: font_family defaults "OpenSansCondensed_TWRI". Can modified locally installed font. point_label character string - want label point legend. overlay measured points box plot, " - Measured   values" appropriate. points indicate outliers, " -   values outside \ninterquartile range" appropriate. can custoimized necessary. Use "\n" indicate line break occur.

title: Create a Boxplot Legend — ggplot_box_legend
text: ggplot object

title: Create a Boxplot Legend — ggplot_box_legend
text: https://waterdata.usgs.gov/blog/boxplots/

title: Create a Boxplot Legend — ggplot_box_legend
text: Laura DeCicco

title: Create a Boxplot Legend — ggplot_box_legend
code: library(ggplot2) library(cowplot) ggplot(dissolved_oxygen) +   geom_boxplot(aes(as.factor(station_id),                    average_do,                    group = station_id)) +   geom_jitter(aes(as.factor(station_id),                   average_do,                   group = station_id),                width = 0.1, alpha = 0.25) +  theme_TWRI_print() -> p1 file <- tempfile(fileext = '.png') ragg::agg_png(file) plot_grid(p1, ggplot_box_legend(), rel_widths = c(2,1)) dev.off() #> agg_png  #>       2

what: Water quality data for Mission and Aransas National Estuarine Research Reserve (NERR) — mission_aransas_nerr
title: Water quality data for Mission and Aransas National Estuarine Research Reserve (NERR) — mission_aransas_nerr
text: Fifteen minute water quality data. Includes station, date-time, temperature, specific conductance, salinity, associated data qualifiers 2020 2021 Mission Aransas (MAR) National Estuarine Research Reserve (NERR). Data NOAA NERRS Centralized Data Management Office.

title: Water quality data for Mission and Aransas National Estuarine Research Reserve (NERR) — mission_aransas_nerr
Water quality data for Mission and Aransas National Estuarine Research Reserve (NERR) — mission_aransas_nerr
text: data frame 140352 rows 10 variables: StationCode station identifier, factor levels marabwq marcewq Aransas Bay Copano East stations respectively. DateTimeStamp sampling date-time yyyy-mm-dd  hh:mm::ss format. Temp water temperature degrees Celsius. F_Temp data qualifier, <0> indicates approved data. SpCond specific conductance µS/cm. F_SpCond data qualifier, <0> indicates approved data. Sal Salinity ppt. F_Sal data qualifier, <0> indicates approved data. DO_mgl dissolved oxygen mg/L. F_DO_mgl data qualifier, <0> indicates approved data.

title: Water quality data for Mission and Aransas National Estuarine Research Reserve (NERR) — mission_aransas_nerr
text: NOAA National Estuarine Research Reserve System (NERRS). 2022. System-Wide Monitoring Program. NOAA NERRS Centralized Data Management Office. http://cdmo.baruch.sc.edu/.

title: Get file path to example data — path_to_file
text: file Name file quotes extension; "arroyo_swqm.txt", "dissolved_oxygen_raw.csv", "easterwood.csv", "marabwq2021.csv", "marcewq2021.csv" work. NULL, example files listed.

title: Get file path to example data — path_to_file
code: path_to_file() #> [1] "arroyo_swqm.txt"          "dissolved_oxygen_raw.csv" #> [3] "easterwood.csv"           "marabwq2021.csv"          #> [5] "marcewq2021.csv"          path_to_file("easterwood.csv") #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/twriTemplates/extdata/easterwood.csv" head(read.csv(path_to_file("easterwood.csv"))) #>      station       date                                    name #> 1 7.4746e+10 2010-07-31 COLLEGE STATION EASTERWOOD FIELD, TX US #> 2 7.4746e+10 2010-08-01 COLLEGE STATION EASTERWOOD FIELD, TX US #> 3 7.4746e+10 2010-08-02 COLLEGE STATION EASTERWOOD FIELD, TX US #> 4 7.4746e+10 2010-08-03 COLLEGE STATION EASTERWOOD FIELD, TX US #> 5 7.4746e+10 2010-08-04 COLLEGE STATION EASTERWOOD FIELD, TX US #> 6 7.4746e+10 2010-08-05 COLLEGE STATION EASTERWOOD FIELD, TX US #>   dailymaximumdrybulbtemperature dailyprecipitation #> 1                             99                  0 #> 2                            102                  0 #> 3                            101                  0 #> 4                            100                  0 #> 5                             99                  0 #> 6                             99                  0

title: Custom color and fill scales — scale_custom
text: palette Name color palette extend Whether extend discrete color palette make sufficient colors levels needed ... Additional arguments passed internal scale function

title: Custom color and fill scales — scale_custom
text: Specific functions include: scale_(color/colour/fill)discrete_twriDiscrete palette either fixed dynamically extended number shades scale(color/colour/fill)opinionated_twriDiscrete palette specific values "good", "bad", "neutral" scale(color/colour/fill)diverging_twriContinuous diverging color palette scale(color/colour/fill)_continuousContinuous color palette

what: a ggplot2 theme formatted in the TWRI style for presentations — theme_TWRI_pres
title: a ggplot2 theme formatted in the TWRI style for presentations — theme_TWRI_pres
text: Provides ggplot2 theme formatted consistent TWRI style guidance. Figure aesthetics prioritize design legibility use power point presentations. intended output 10 inches 7.5 inches 200dpi.

a ggplot2 theme formatted in the TWRI style for presentations — theme_TWRI_pres
text: base_size default text size px base_family defaults "Moriston_personal". Generally, use sensible sans serif font available system. base_line_size default line size base_rect_size default rect size

what: a ggplot2 theme formatted in the TWRI style — theme_TWRI_print
title: a ggplot2 theme formatted in the TWRI style — theme_TWRI_print
text: Provides ggplot2 theme formatted consistent TWRI style guidance. Use theme figures intended printed reports. default font "Open Sans Condensed". suggest export width 6.5 inches 300 dpi.

title: a ggplot2 theme formatted in the TWRI style — theme_TWRI_print
a ggplot2 theme formatted in the TWRI style — theme_TWRI_print
text: base_size default text size px base_family defaults "OpenSansCondensed_TWRI". provided package. Generally, use sensible sans serif font available system. base_line_size default line size base_rect_size default rect size

what: twriTemplates: Templates for TWRI reports — twriTemplates-package
title: twriTemplates: Templates for TWRI reports — twriTemplates-package
text: Provides word pdf Rmarkdown templates meet TWRI branding guidance. twriTemplates package provides rmarkdown templates follow internal brand guidance. also provides functions formatting ggplot2 plots follow brand guides.

title: twriTemplates: Templates for TWRI reports — twriTemplates-package
text: Maintainer: Michael Schramm michael.schramm@ag.tamu.edu (ORCID) contributors: Texas Water Resources Institute [copyright holder] Laura DeCicco ('ggplot_box_legend()') [contributor]

what: RMD Word Template for TWRI — twri_docx
title: RMD Word Template for TWRI — twri_docx
text: Development twri_docx() complete. recommended use officedown::rdocx_document() directly. function retained older templates include function, although rendered documents might inconsistent. suggested update reports latest version twriTemplates twri_docx() may removed future versions. Loads Rmarkdown template produce Microsoft word document consistent institute brand guidance.

title: RMD Word Template for TWRI — twri_docx
code: twri_docx(   base_format = "bookdown::word_document2",   tables = list(),   plots = list(),   lists = list(),   mapstyles = list(),   page_size = list(),   page_margins = list(),   reference_num = TRUE,   toc = FALSE,   number_sections = TRUE,   fig_captions = TRUE,   reference_docx = "format.docx",   ... )

title: RMD Word Template for TWRI — twri_docx
text: base_format character, either rmarkdown::word_document bookdown::word_document2 (default) tables empty list, used officedown::rdocx_document() plots empty list, used officedown::rdocx_document() lists empty list, used officedown::rdocx_document() mapstyles empty list, used officedown::rdocx_document() page_size empty list, used officedown::rdocx_document() page_margins empty list, used officedown::rdocx_document() reference_num TRUE text references sections section number. FALSE text references sections section title. Default TRUE. toc logical defaults FALSE. template utilizes TOC function Word can manually removed customized. number_sections logical fig_captions logical reference_docx character, specifies template document use. ... additional arguments officedown::rdocx_document()

text: add pkgdown template packages use pkgdown document package add contributors

title: twriTemplates 0.2.2

title: twriTemplates 0.2.2

title: twriTemplates 0.2.1
text: fixed issue gridlines overlapped axis lines (#8) fix latex error chunk code displayed (#7)

title: twriTemplates 0.2.0
text: Initial package release. Includes two rmarkdown templates word pdf document creation. Includes two ggplot2 themes print presentation graphics. Unit testing handled testthat Github actions used r-cmd-check
